text: Hinehauone Coralie Cook (née Cameron; 1904 - 1993) was a New Zealand artist. == Life == Hinehauone was born at Masterton, New Zealand. === Art training === She began art training in 1925. She received art lessons from Miss Beard of Masterton. She traveled to Paris, France, and then to London, UK. == Career == The span of Cook's artworks lasted from the early 1930s to the late 1950s. In 1937, her artworks were exhibited at the New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts under the name Corrie Cameron. == References == Category:1904 births Category:1993 deaths Category:20th-century New Zealand women artists Category:People from Masterton
title: Hinehauone Coralie Cook
